source_note: State baseline derived from Illinois EPA Solid Waste and Recycling Program and major municipal programs.

organics.guidance: Composting and yard waste recycling encouraged under Illinois EPA rules; commercial food scrap composting expanding.
organics.bin: Green/organics bin or compost drop-off site.
organics.notes: Chicago and Urbana-Champaign support pilot food scrap collection.

paper_cardboard.guidance: Recycle clean, dry paper and cardboard; flatten boxes.

glass_containers.guidance: Recycle glass bottles and jars (rinsed, no lids).
provenance: City of Chicago recycling materials list

metal_containers.guidance: Recycle aluminum and steel/tin cans; rinse before recycling.
metal_containers.notes: No aerosol cans or scrap metal.

plastics.guidance: Recycle bottles, jugs, and containers labeled #1â€“#5; check local rules for others.
plastics.notes: Plastic bags and foam not accepted curbside.

beverage_containers_crv.guidance: Illinois does not have a container deposit program.
beverage_containers_crv.bin: Recycle in curbside or drop-off bin.
beverage_containers_crv.notes: No CRV or refund law in place.

household_batteries.guidance: Recycle rechargeable and lead-acid batteries through collection sites or HHW programs.
household_batteries.notes: Keep batteries out of household trash.
provenance: Illinois EPA HHW and battery recycling

e_waste.guidance: Electronics recycling required under Illinois Electronic Products Recycling and Reuse Act.
e_waste.notes: Includes TVs, monitors, printers, and computers.

plastic_bags_and_film.guidance: Plastic bags and film not accepted curbside.
plastic_bags_and_film.bin: Return to retail store collection bins.

bulky_items.guidance: Bulky waste must be scheduled for pickup or taken to a landfill.
bulky_items.notes: Rules and fees depend on hauler or city.
provenance: Chicago Streets & Sanitation bulky item info
